messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: shower rings was:breastfeeding in public
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/18/03 7:47:50 PM Pacific Daylight Time, ... Okay, so orginally I wasn t going to admit that I read it this way too, because I really
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/18/03 7:47:50 PM Pacific Daylight Time,
mccluskieo@... writes:

> Me too!! In fact, the way I understood it was a boppie pillow for
> the shower. Stupid thing is I never thought past that to
> think, "Why in the world would you nurse a baby in the
> shower??" ..LMAO!! When everyone was speaking about a cover, I
> thought it was some special waterproof cover..LOL! To top it all
> off, I had one of those pillows and used it to nurse my second!!
>
> Olga :)
> --- In UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com, AimeeL73@c... wrote:
> >dezigna@c... writes:
> >>I read this three times with the image of your friend standing
> in her
> >>shower with the thing around her like a life preserver before I
> realized
> >>you meant her baby shower.
> >>
> >>Robyn Coburn
>

Okay, so orginally I wasn't going to admit that I read it this way too,
because I really thought I'd be the only one. Since I never breastfed, I assumed it
was some kind of baby holder that had a non-slip cover of sorts, since the
wee ones are so slippery in the shower!!! LMAO. So everytime I read someone else
thought they were made for the shower, I feel much better.

Life is funny.
Rhonda


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
